message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Vote: constitutive character → shortened to character">
The author proposes: introduce "constitutive character (德 De)" at first occurrence with a TN that explicitly tells the reader it will be shortened to "character" in the following paragraphs. Then use plain "character" throughout the rest of the text.

This gives:
- Precision at introduction (constitutive character)
- Lightweight running text (character)
- Reader is explicitly told about the shortening, so no confusion

YES or NO? Brief response.
</teammate-message>

input.content: YES. Best of both worlds -- "constitutive" does its work once at the point of introduction, then gets out of the way.
input.summary: Votes YES on constitutive character → character shortening

routing.summary: Votes YES on constitutive character → character shortening
routing.content: YES. Best of both worlds -- "constitutive" does its work once at the point of introduction, then gets out of the way.

content.text: Voted YES on the compromise: introduce as "constitutive character (德 De)" with a TN explaining the shortening, then use plain "character" in running text. Waiting for further instructions.
